column5: as title, anyone knows which store carries the new Rapala Concept Ti?  I know Lebaron carries Rapala rods but they chose not to carry the new Concept Ti..  The thing looks like a winner on paper, but I want to try it first hand to see..
I think most Rapala rod retailers will have them. For the time being, I imagine they're stockpiling in China.

Last year I was interested in putting my hands on their shift series reels, not the rods, to see how they felt compared to my standard reels. None to be found at a retailer. I likly would have bought the same reels anyway but I wanted to see what they had to offer.

A website in the US actually writes articles about Canadian only market Rapala rods and reels, products that I NEVER see, and I'm a tackle junkie. They must have the worlds worst salesmen distributing their stuff.
I've read that same opinion expressed on another forum. It seems like rapala is creating a bunch of new products but they are awfully hard to find.
Lebaron has the Shift and the R type series.. they used to carry the Classic trout but doesn't anymore  I just want to hold the Concept ti and see if it's really that good
I will have some.  Could possibly be at the TO show too.
perfect, I'll be at the show  have you played with them first hand? how do they feel? and what would the pricing be on these guys?
grimsby tackle usually holds a good amount of rapala rods and reels. be worth the effort to give a call to them and see what they might have.

No I haven't had the chance to hold one yet unfortunately, but those I know who have are really "excited" about them.  still working out the pricing, will PM you once it is all arranged.  I have comfirmed they will be at the TO show.  Good Fishing!
please be cheap, please be cheap... lol  the new BPS carbonlite would be going on it (provided I like it when I see it).. it would be nice to have a combo under 10oz
Anyone know where I can find the NT85TR64M1 (Medium/Casting) version of this rod?
Was at sail on the weekend they had a bunch of rapala reels and rods don't know if they have the one your looking for though, check them on line.
The last time I was there, they had the MH only.  Guess I'll check again before bass opener, lol
